ygData.subject: Re: neat C++: stuck: calculating network depth in the XOR experiment

I confirmed using a log file that it is getting stuck in a loop.

I also no=
ticed that the function has changed from NEATv1.1 and the latest C++ versio=
n NEATv.1.2.1.

In particular, erkin changed the following fragment of the =
code which seems right to me.

NEATv1.2.1: if (cur_depth>max) max=3Dcur_dep=
th;
NEATv1.1  : if (cur_depth>d) max=3Dcur_depth;


I again request you to =
please let me know what needs to be done to correct this bug.


--- In neat=
@yahoogroups.com, "ashishjain87" <ashishjain.mit@...> wrote:
>
> Dear All,
=
> 
> 
> I have tried to run the xor experiment several times for several nu=
mber of generations.
> 
> 1) xor_test(5), works every time.
> 2) xor_test(1=
0), works every time
> 3) xor_test(100), worked only once out of 10 or so t=
rials.
> 
> I tried to investigate further. It seems that the program is ge=
tting stuck while trying to calculate the network depth inside the function=
 xor_evaluate() [experiments.cpp]
> 
> Line 158:  net=3Dorg->net;
> Line 15=
9:  numnodes=3D((org->gnome)->nodes).size();
> Line 160:
> Line 161:  net_d=
epth=3Dnet->max_depth(); // GETTING STUCK HERE
> 
> I tried to look deeper.=
 The function Network::depth(arguments) is itself pretty simple. It is actu=
ally getting stuck inside NNode::depth(arguments) which is a function defin=
ed in nnode.cpp on line 399. This is a recursive function. It is getting st=
uck even when the recursion is off.
> 
> Kindly advise. 
> 
> 
> Ashish
>

=
